content.description: Climb the face just right of the arete. Some very sharp and tiny face holds await you at the crux.
content.location: Just right of the arete on the Bob Block. Route #10 on The Bob Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the face across the corridor from Snip, Snip, Snip. Follow the route diagonaling left from the base to the top.
content.location: Across the corridor from Snip, Snip, Snip. Route #12 on The Bob Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the route directly across from The Corner. Use the appropriately spaced horizontals to gain access to the top.
content.location: Route is the first route you'll see on the Bob Block. Across from The Corner. Route #13 on The BOB Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the face 12' left of the corner climb up and get a good cam in the horizontal. Continue up on face holds to the slab above. Clip the two bolts and finish.  Feels like a sandbag at 5.9, especially if you are short.
content.protection: Protect the horizontal with a piece of gear below the very high first bolt.
content.location: Back side of The Bob Block, through the corridor and then to climber's left of Easier Done then Said, #8 on The Bob Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Sport route on The Bob Block.  The rating on this route might be a touch soft.  There is a single move crux and the rest of the route is probably only 5.8.  Young Michael did his first drilling on this route, hence the name.
content.location: Route #11 on The Bob Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb through the overhang, Finish on the arete and slab above.
content.location: Climbs the arete on the Bob Block. Across from Dream the Impossible. Route #9 on The BOB Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the crescent shaped crack to the top.
content.location:
This climb is actually not on Bob Block but on the wall that is directly behind The Bob Block. This is the only route on this wall...

 Route #7 on The BOB Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: There's a handful of good climbs here. New additions "Stembellishment," "The Puzzler" and the latter's direct variation "Heir Rider Equipped" are some of the most enjoyable moderates at The Lost Crag.  Not to be missed.  For those not wanting to set top ropes on these climbs, there is a scramble approach on the side of the block just to the right of "Horizontal Bop."  Bring one quick draw to clip over the sloping  rise and to pull on as you make the move over the step.  This piece of aid helps a great deal to avoid the somewhat sketchy move to access the top of the block.  You can also use the draw to lower yourself back down before easily retrieving it.
